caption: The Canal Saint-Martin, one of Paris‚Äôs most charming and scenic waterways, offers a peaceful retreat from the city‚Äôs hustle and bustle. Stretching for nearly 4.5 kilometers, the canal winds its way through trendy neighborhoods like Le Marais and the 10th arrondissement, lined with leafy trees, picturesque bridges, and vibrant caf√©s.  Originally built in the early 19th century to supply fresh water to the city, the canal has since become a popular spot for leisurely walks, boat rides, and picnics by the water. The canal‚Äôs tranquil atmosphere, combined with its artistic vibe, makes it a favorite destination for locals and tourists alike.  Whether you're enjoying a caf√© by the water, exploring the nearby boutiques, or taking a relaxing boat tour, Canal Saint-Martin is a perfect blend of nature, culture, and Parisian charm.
Interesting to see how it works for the boats to go through the canal. Good views and it has a park where you can rest.

Beautiful canal Saint Martin, located in quite strategic area between Republique, and Saint Germain des Pres. this canal also serves the tourist attractions for canal cruise crossings, as an alternative route from La Seine river bateaux bus. It was cold but also sunny here, many people sitting down enjoy their days sitting on the benches.  Many beautiful jardins in the neighborhood and also restaurants and cafes nearby.

This is one of our favourite parts to come for a peaceful walk, we love the grittiness of the surrounds, there are many places to sit and enjoy the tranquility, we also love the sparkling water dispensers scattered around.
Nice walk on a Sunday morning. It felt safe and enjoyable!!

Canal Saint Martin offers a picturesque setting for a post-work stroll, shaded by trees and dotted with charming bars and restaurants perfect for unwinding. Its relaxed ambiance gives off a local vibe, away from the hustle and bustle of touristy areas. During my visit after work, I found it to be a tranquil spot to enjoy a leisurely drink and soak in the authentic Parisian atmosphere.
Amazing area to chill out in. Very unique for Paris.

LOVE THIS NEIGHBORHOOD.  Beautiful to walk along the canal - I did it for the entire stretch (both sides). It's a youngish area with lots of students. Also noticed quite a few Asian restaurants which I would love to try next time I'm there. As seems to be the case throughout the world, there are quite a few homeless encampments both along the canal and in doorways.
Loved that cute spot in Paris
Still feel the vibes of old Paris

We went with the Paris Canal tour up the canal and loved it. It's fun going through the locks and it's very pleasant to enjoy the trip on the water after walking all day. Definitely something is recommend. It takes about 2.5 hours.

We noticed on the map there is a canal near out hotel and we thought why not check it out. It was good that we did it as it was surprisingly cool, possibly because of the body of water and lots of trees along its bank. The canal isn‚Äôt wide but lengthy and is a joy to stroll alongside it. Plenty of bars and restaurants along the walk. Its quite a quiet place though. Not sure whether its man-made or natural ü§îü§îü§î

One of my favorite places in Paris. I do my jogging there. I take drinks in the cafes. I read, I compose, I write. So inspiring during all seasons. It‚Äôs a must to visit this wonderful area. Highly recommended.
Nothing special of a place. The bridges are not quite in a good conservation state or cleanliness, and there is overall bad smell. Around that area there are cool places to eat and bars though.

Without realizing the pathway of the Canal Saint-Martin , we wandered this visually stunning waterway along the Quai de Valmy street to the Frederick Lemaitre Statue area where it was covered to create boulevards and public spaces ( it is 4.6 km long) and then it emerges near The Bastille Square and drains into the River Seine...Quite a very delightful experience

This is a cute little more quiet site in Paris, it looks a little bit like a canal from Amsterdam but then with high bridges to cross it, be aware of pickpockets though, nothing to really worry about just stay alert. Looks really good at night too.

We visited in the early spring and found the area to be not very picturesque and one of our least favorite places to walk around in Paris. Probably in late spring or summer the views are better but it didn't really stand out compared to some of the other wonderful places we walked around.
The canal is so nice for taking a stroll when the sun is shining brightly. You could feel and see the green and young community thriving along the canal.

The atmosphere is unique, pleasant and wavy. You have to be there to know what if feels like. It‚Äôs like you never wanna leave the riverside once you are around it..  Though, it‚Äôs sad you don‚Äôt have much to do along the canal.
Great boat trip on the canals. Perfect for a rainy afternoon.
You have to see it and feel the atmosphere. It's a super place.
It‚Äôs really nice to take a walk along the canal in a beautiful winter evening. I have enjoyed the walk very much
go in the summer, it must be beautiful. we went on a cloudy february day and it was nothing special.
We had a lovely walk along the Canal, we even stopped to enjoy some drinks at a lovely cafe along the way
great place to chill with friends .. les crowded than la seine .. the neighbourds are not the safest though
This is one of the loveliest areas in Paris, and thankfully it's not over run with tourists. It's a wonderful place to come and sit and just take in the beautiful surroundings.
It has its own beautiful and peaceful vibe!
So many of the local sitting out with picnic lunches and bottles of wine, enjoying the outdoor weather and great company.
Great place to chill at evening. Crowded but big enough area for enjoy.
There was the time when rivers and canals could bring you in any part of France. If only this canal could tell us stories
Beautiful neighborhood, perfect for a cozy walk through the city.
Beautiful canal with walkaways on both sides. Amazon views and wonderful walk.
Fantastic, beautiful, wonderful atmosphere, have a lovely swim, well put together,just brilliant üëè ‚Ä¶
Nice place to walk a little bit, however there not so much to do around
Really pretty. Great for picnic on the benches. Shame we can‚Äôt skip stones on the lock like Amelie.
Well worth the 2.5 hour slow cruising trip through the locks along the Canal
A must-see. Attempt a quick cruise on the canal as well if you can. I was just a bit taken aback by the surroundings that need a good cleaning.
Wonderful for an icecream in the afternoon. Nice ambiente.
